settings.text:
Whether you choose to give birth at home, at a birthing center, or a hospital, I will be by your side throughout labor to provide encouragement, comfort, and information when questions arise.

Beginning at 37 weeks, I will be available 24/7 on call. After contacting me at onset of labor, I will be constantly available via phone, video call, and text to provide support as you labor at home or with you at your preferred delivery location through the duration of labor. You can call me for any question, no matter how big or small, anything you need your doula for.

I will remain with you in the immediate hours after your baby is born to assist in skin-to-skin bonding and feeding your baby. I will also arrange to visit with you once you are settled at home, to discuss your experience, give support at home, and see how life is with your new bundle.

Whether you choose to give birth at home, at a birthing center, or a hospital, I will be by your side throughout labor to provide encouragement, comfort, and information when questions arise.

Beginning at 37 weeks, I will be available 24/7 on call. After contacting me at onset of labor, I will be constantly available via phone, video call, and text to provide support as you labor at home or with you at your preferred delivery location through the duration of labor. You can call me for any question, no matter how big or small, anything you need your doula for.

I will remain with you in the immediate hours after your baby is born to assist in skin-to-skin bonding and feeding your baby. I will also arrange to visit with you once you are settled at home, to discuss your experience, give support at home, and see how life is with your new bundle.

settings.heading: Rebozo Massage
settings.row_content: Utilizing the traditional Mexican technique of using a shawl-like cloth, your doula will provide gentle and soothing movements to help ease tension and promote relaxation.

settings.heading: Birthing Ball & Peanut Ball
settings.row_content: Your doula will assist you in using a birthing ball, a large inflatable ball, as a tool for comfort, support, and optimal positioning during labor.

settings.heading: Breathing Techniques
settings.row_content: Your doula will guide you through various breathing techniques to manage pain so you stay relaxed, feel calm and focused on birthing your baby.

settings.heading: Complimentary Birth Photography & Video
settings.row_content: As a special gift, your doula will capture precious moments of your labor and birth through photography and video, which will be provided to you on a flash drive to treasure for a lifetime.

settings.heading: Birth Room Ambiance & Aromatherapy
settings.row_content: Your doula will create a calming and soothing environment in your birth room with a Himalayan salt lamp, tiny tea lights, essential oil diffuser for aromatherapy, arnica massage oil and many more tools specific to your needs.

settings.heading: Counter Pressure & Physcial Support
settings.row_content: Provide techniques like hip squeezes, back pressure, and other hands-on comfort measures.

settings.heading: Hydrotherapy Assistance
settings.row_content: If the birthing facility has the resources, I can assist with using water for pain relief, either through a shower, bath, or birthing pool.

settings.heading: Acupressure or Light Touch Massage
settings.row_content: These techniques can help manage labor pain and promote relaxation.

settings.heading: Position Suggestions
settings.row_content: Offer guidance on different labor positions that can help ease discomfort, assist with baby's descent, and enhance the progress of labor.

settings.heading: Emotional Support
settings.row_content: Continual emotional reassurance and encouragement can be incredibly helpful during labor.

settings.heading: Visualization and Mindfulness Techniques
settings.row_content: Guiding the mother through visualization exercises or mindfulness meditation can help manage pain and anxiety.

settings.heading: Advocacy
settings.row_content: Help the mother understand her options at every stage of labor, assist in communicating with the medical team, and support her in making informed decisions.

settings.heading: TENS Unit
settings.row_content: a TENS (Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation) unit can be used for pain relief during labor.

settings.heading: Cooling & Heating Therapy
settings.row_content: Simple things like cool washcloths on the forehead or a warm blanket can provide comfort.

settings.heading: Immediate Postpartum Support
settings.row_content: Several hours of immediate postpartum support, including assistance with initial breastfeeding, bonding, and settling in at home or the birthing facility.
